abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Immunization
            Strengthening Project for India were as follows: the outcome
            was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, the Bank
            performance was unsatisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project:
            Technically sound research in important program areas can
            lead to better policies. Successful monitoring of progress
            with a large-scale priority program of this kind needs much
            greater attention to data sources, timeliness, and quality.
            Constant and independent technical guidance is critical for
            disease control programs. A high level of political
            awareness and attention is a major asset in reinvigorating a
            large, and lagging, existing program. Clearly delineated
            roles and responsibilities of center and states and follow
            up to ensure that these roles and functions are being
            adequately executed will ensure better results. Shared
            vision will strengthen partnership between the government
            and the development partners. Development objectives must be
            carefully calibrated to reflect the scope and inputs
            supported under the project. Adequate attention must be paid
            up-front to operational issues, such as procurement.
